name: WASP-4
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-4 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-4 is a star with 0.86 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.89 times its radius. It is located 878.0445675999998 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WASP-4 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-4 system

WASP-4 b

WASP-4 b was discovered by the SuperWASP observatory using the Transit method. The mass of WASP-4 b is 376.94638 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-4 b is 14.807 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, WASP-4 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-4 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-4, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by SuperWASP.
